title: Constructivist-Based Instructional Design Model Development Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design principles and understanding of the ADDIE model
context.additional_context: A course for enhancing instructional design capabilities in language education within a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, emphasizing a constructivist approach to enable learners to develop flexible models applicable to real educational settings.

learning_goals: Learners can develop personalized instructional design models based on constructivist principles.
Learners can redesign core elements of the ADDIE model to create structures applicable to educational settings.
Learners can acquire creative approaches to express instructional design models through dynamic or metaphorical structures.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
